children.text: Content Standard 1: Students shall apply the essential skills and techniques to perform music.
Demonstrate characteristic tone quality in extended registers using all dynamic levels
Perform intervals with accurate intonation
Demonstrate accurate intonation within large or small ensembles

Demonstrate vertical alignment within an ensemble
  • internalizing beat
  • following conductor (e.g., preparatory beat, tempo changes, meter, rubato)
  • varied meters (e.g., simple, compound, asymmetrical)
  • rhythmic patterns (e.g., dotted eighth and sixteenth notes, syncopation, duplets, triplets, tied notes)
  • meter changes (e.g., to )
Perform in a small ensemble without a conductor

Perform scales by memory
  • major (e.g., C, G, D, A, E, B, F, Bb, Eb, Ab, Db, Gb)
  • minor (e.g., a, e, b, f#, c#, g#, d, g, c, f, bb, eb)
  • chromatic

Perform rudiments by memory (e.g., single stroke, double stroke, five stroke, seven stroke roll, nine stroke roll, single paradiddle, double paradiddle, flam accent, flamacue, flam paradiddle, drag, double drag tap, single ratamacue)

Perform instrument-specific technique builders in various major and minor keys (e,g, lip slurs for brass, arpeggios, thirds, etudes, chorales, tonguing and slurring patterns, double stops for percussion, octaves)
Sight-read increasingly complex music literature
Content Standard 2: Students shall demonstrate creative expression through music.
Perform music of greater complexity in contrasting styles (e.g., marches, suites, overtures, Baroque, Romantic, Classical, ragtime, jazz)
Improvise rhythmic and melodic variations utilizing different keys in a specific style and meter
Perform to achieve a characteristic ensemble sound at all dynamic levels (e.g., balance, blend, intonation)

Perform fundamental elements and principles of phrasing and expression
  • tempi (e.g., grave, lento, andante, moderato, allegro, presto)
  • expressive markings (e.g., cantabile, dolce, grandioso, maestoso)
  • articulations (e.g., tenuto, staccato, legato, accents, marcato)
  • dynamics [e.g., crescendo, decrescendo, pianissimo (pp), piano (p), mezzo piano (mp), mezzo forte (mf), forte (f), fortissimo (ff)]
Content Standard 3: Students shall listen to, describe, analyze, perform, and evaluate music.
Compare and contrast examples of a varied repertoire of music (e.g., classical, pop, jazz, marches)
Develop criteria for evaluating instrumental music performances
Evaluate individual and group musical performances orally and in written format (e.g., journal, blog, graphic organizer)
Exhibit proper etiquette in rehearsal, performances, and audience settings
Content Standard 4: Students shall make connections between music and other disciplines.
Describe characteristics of contemporary band literature with emphasis on Arkansas composers (e.g., Francis McBeth, Clifton Williams, William Grant Still)
Research career opportunities in music education and performance
Evaluate the role of music in various cultures throughout history
Describe cultural and technological influences on music (e.g., software, hardware, recording, Web 2.0)
Demonstrate espirit de corps
